name: memorability
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
the quality of being likely to be remembered or worth remembering: Many animated films are known for their memorability, but this one isn't memorable. Whether a name is easy or difficult to pronounce can have a big effect on its memorability.
More examplesFewer examplesAdvertising may increase awareness of a particular type of product more than the memorability of a particular brand.None of his operas has the sheer memorability that Mozart managed time and time again.The poet was a master of rhyme and metre, and had a gift for memorability.Advertising that is poor in memorability is more likely to be unproductive for the advertiser.
